perturbation.original_text:
5.1  The Principal shall pay the Company a fee of $1.00 (one dollar), inclusive
      of VAT, per one net tonne of Commodity shipped pursuant to this Contract.

5.2  The Principal shall pay the commission fee for each delivered batch of
      Commodity to the Company's account within 30 (thirty) banking days after
      the Delivery Date.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1  The Principal shall pay the Company a fee, inclusive
      of VAT, per one net tonne of Commodity shipped pursuant to this Contract.

5.2  The Principal shall pay the commission fee for each delivered batch of
      Commodity to the Company's account within 30 (thirty) banking days after
      the Delivery Date.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific amount of the fee ($1.00), the contract becomes ambiguous about the exact amount the Principal needs to pay, leading to potential disputes and difficulties in enforcement. Section 5.1 still dictates that a fee must be paid, but the lack of a defined monetary value creates an internal contradiction, as the payment obligation is undefined. The original fixed fee becomes a variable one.

perturbation.original_text:
3.1  Unless otherwise agreed by the Parties, the Principal shall at all times
      deliver to the Company Karakuduk Commodity pursuant to this Contract. The
      Company shall ensure that (i) during the Principal Period, the quality of
      Commodity delivered at the relevant delivery point shall be REBCO, and (ii)
      during the Secondary Period, the quality of Commodity delivered at the CPC
      Terminal shall be Karakuduk Commodity for segregated batch deliveries or
      shall be CPC Blend for deliveries for which segregated batch delivery is
      not available.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.1  Unless otherwise agreed by the Parties, the Principal shall at all times
      deliver Commodity pursuant to this Contract. The
      Company shall ensure that (i) during the Principal Period, the quality of
      Commodity delivered at the relevant delivery point shall be REBCO, and (ii)
      during the Secondary Period, the quality of Commodity delivered at the CPC
      Terminal shall be Commodity for segregated batch deliveries or
      shall be CPC Blend for deliveries for which segregated batch delivery is
      not available.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'Karakuduk' commodity it is undefined what commodity is being described, creating an internal contradiction, as the delivery obligation is undefined. The Principal Period refers to 'REBCO' but during the Secondary Period it only references to 'Commodity', while previously specifying 'Karakuduk Commodity'.

perturbation.original_text:
4.2  At all times during the term of this Contract, the Principal shall:

(i)  Deliver Karakuduk Commodity to the Company at Metering Point 719 (PSP
      Samara of the Western branch office of KazTransOil) in the amount
      determined in accordance with item 1.2 of this Agreement;
perturbation.changed_text:
4.2  At all times during the term of this Contract, the Principal shall:

(i)  Deliver Commodity to the Company at Metering Point 719 (PSP
      Samara of the Western branch office of KazTransOil) in the amount
      determined in accordance with item 1.2 of this Agreement;
perturbation.explanation: By removing the adjective 'Karakuduk', the quality of 'Commodity' becomes undefined. The principal still is obligated to deliver 'Commodity' according to section 1.2, but not specifying what type will create uncertainty for enforcement
